original: Josiah Wedgwood (1730–1795) was a notable English potter and entrepreneur who significantly influenced the pottery industry and marketing practices of his time. He observed how aristocratic fashions evolved and gradually permeated through various social classes. Recognizing this trend, Wedgwood pioneered innovative marketing techniques to shape and direct prevailing tastes and preferences, ensuring that his products gained acceptance am
